meanings.definition: Forming or developing calluses on the skin.
meanings.sent1: Her callusing hands showed she worked hard.
meanings.sent2: The callusing skin on his feet protected him from blisters.
meanings.sent3: The callusing fingertips made playing the guitar easier for her.
meanings.sent4: His callusing palms were a testament to his dedication to gardening.
meanings.sent5: The callusing calluses on her palms were a badge of honor.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming hardened or toughened.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the callusing of the leather made it durable.
meanings.sent2: The callusing of his resolve helped him face challenges.
meanings.sent3: The callusing of the ice cream made it difficult to scoop.
meanings.sent4: The callusing of his heart made him less sensitive to criticism.
meanings.sent5: The slow callusing of the wood gave it strength and resilience.

meanings.definition: To cause a callus to form on the skin.
meanings.sent1: Wearing ill-fitting shoes can callusing your heels.
meanings.sent2: The constant friction callusing her hands.
meanings.sent3: He tried callusing his fingers to improve his grip.
meanings.sent4: The rough work callusing his palms quickly.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's tools callusing his hands over time.
